instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1369: What is A1369? A1369 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2010, Mid 2011 with EMC 2392, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2838, 820-3023..
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..

threads.title: Are the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 MacBook Air LCD panels the same?
Are the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 MacBook Air LCD panels the same?
Are the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 MacBook Air LCD panels the same?
threads.message: I use LP133WP1-TJAA universally for all years from 2010-2015 with no issues.

threads.title: Are the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 MacBook Air LCD panels the same?
threads.message: Good question, and thanks for the heads up Louis

threads.title: Are the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 MacBook Air LCD panels the same?
threads.message: No, iSight cables are different for 2013+. Buying a bare LCD has not been economical for years now. LP133WP1 is $200+, complete assembles can be found for $250.

threads.title: Are the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 MacBook Air LCD panels the same?
threads.message: I'm just talking about the panels, not the entire assembly, glad to hear their the same :)

threads.title: Are the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 MacBook Air LCD panels the same?
threads.message:
assetgenie in Pennsylvania still sells the LP133WP1-TJAA for $100-$120. I bought most of my stock when it was still $72 from PSI. I have at least 160 left, an excellent investment thus far! Full assembly means there's no profit left. We charge $325 to fix the screen... I could make either $75 or $200. I'd rather make the $200!

duke is correct that each year has a different length wifi cable/different isight cable.

threads.title: Are the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 MacBook Air LCD panels the same?
threads.message: Ok, is it then possible to swap the isight/wifi cable to fit if using a different assembly. The Bezel is fairly easy to take off.

threads.title: Are the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 MacBook Air LCD panels the same?
threads.message: No camera design is totally different.

threads.title: Are the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 MacBook Air LCD panels the same?
threads.message: Ok, thank you, love the experience level on this forum...

threads.title: Are the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 MacBook Air LCD panels the same?
threads.message:

threads.title: Are the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 MacBook Air LCD panels the same?
threads.message: I don't know who the f those people are

threads.title: Are the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 MacBook Air LCD panels the same?
threads.message: [USER="1"]larossmann[/USER] The part number is the same as the one you use so is there any way to tell whether it's a quality screen other than just trial and error. How do you go about getting high quality screens?

threads.title: Are the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 MacBook Air LCD panels the same?
threads.message: It's Alibaba, if you ask for the current price they will tell you $200+. You may get pulled panels, you never know what those Chinese will sell you. At this time 13" Air assemblies are just not feasible for repair because of a lack of good LCDs.

threads.title: Are the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 MacBook Air LCD panels the same?
threads.message: could you pls give us contact for assetgenie in Pennsylvania , so i can buy some.... i need like 2-3 of them ... or would you sale from ur stock ?

threads.title: Are the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 MacBook Air LCD panels the same?
threads.message: One more question here, I have a cracked but functional 13" 2011 monitor, can I use this when testing display output across all models or do I need to change the LVDS cable between +-2013 boards?

threads.title: Are the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 MacBook Air LCD panels the same?
threads.message: You have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> assembly. The pinout of <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> is slightly different, look at the diagrams.

threads.title: Are the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 MacBook Air LCD panels the same?
